intro: Psychotria rufopilis, commonly known as the red-hair psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, reddish hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria rufopilis is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
